thag9.1:0.4_0: this is what he calls this.
thag9.1:1.1_0: “When old age and death are suffering,
thag9.1:1.2_0: yet an ignorant ordinary person is bound to them.”
thag9.1:1.3_0: When an astute person fully understands this, and they are mindful, practicing absorption:
thag9.1:1.4_0: there is no greater pleasure than this.
thag9.1:10.0_0: The account of the thirty-six streams
thag9.1:10.3_0: At the end of the nines,
thag9.1:10.4_0: These verses never spoke these verses.
thag9.1:2.1_0: When clinging, the carrier of suffering,
thag9.1:2.2_0: and craving, the carrier of this painful mass of proliferation,
thag9.1:2.3_0: are destroyed, and one is mindful, practicing absorption:
thag9.1:2.4_0: there is no greater pleasure than this.
thag9.1:3.1_0: When the eightfold way, so full of grace,
thag9.1:3.2_0: the supreme path, cleanser of all corruptions,
thag9.1:3.3_0: is seen with wisdom; and one is mindful, practicing absorption:
thag9.1:3.4_0: there is no greater pleasure than this.
thag9.1:4.1_0: When one develops that peaceful state,
thag9.1:4.3_0: cleanser of all corruptions, cutter of fetters and bonds:
thag9.1:4.4_0: there is no greater pleasure than this.
thag9.1:5.1_0: When the thunder-cloud rumbles in the sky,
thag9.1:5.2_0: while the rain pours on the path of birds everywhere,
thag9.1:5.4_0: there is no greater pleasure than this.
thag9.1:6.1_0: When sitting on a riverbank covered in flowers,
thag9.1:6.2_0: garlanded with brightly colored forest plants,
thag9.1:6.3_0: one is truly happy, practicing absorption:
thag9.1:6.4_0: there is no greater pleasure than this.
thag9.1:7.1_0: When it is midnight in a lonely forest,
thag9.1:7.2_0: and the sky rains, and the lions roar,
thag9.1:7.4_0: there is no greater pleasure than this.
thag9.1:8.1_0: When one’s own thoughts have stopped,
thag9.1:8.2_0: between two mountains, sheltered inside a cleft,
thag9.1:8.3_0: without stress or heartlessness, practicing absorption:
thag9.1:8.4_0: there is no greater pleasure than this.
thag9.1:9.1_0: When one is happy, destroyer of stains, heartlessness, and sorrow,
thag9.1:9.2_0: free of obstructions, entanglements, and thorns,
thag9.1:9.3_0: and with all defilements annihilated, practicing absorption:
thag9.1:9.4_0: there is no greater pleasure than this.
thag9.1:9.7_0: The Book of the Nines is finished.
